message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids such as beclomethasone can increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis, a fungal infection in the mouth and throat. Bradycardia is not an adverse effect of inhaled corticosteroids. High-pitched voice and hypoglycemia are not known adverse effects of inhaled corticosteroids.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The most common adverse effect of low-dose inhaled corticosteroids is oropharyngeal candidiasis, which can occur when the medication is not rinsed from the mouth after use. Bradycardia, high-pitched voice, and hypoglycemia are not common adverse effects of inhaled corticosteroids.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Beclomethasone is a corticosteroid inhaler and can increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis (thrush), especially at low doses. The other options are not associated with the use of beclomethasone.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids like beclomethasone can cause oropharyngeal candidiasis as an adverse effect, especially when used at high doses. Bradycardia and hypoglycemia are not likely adverse effects of inhaled beclomethasone, and the high-pitched voice is a potential adverse effect of high-dose inhaled corticosteroids, which is not the case in this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis, which is the most likely adverse effect in this scenario. Bradycardia, high-pitched voice, and hypoglycemia are not associated with inhaled corticosteroid use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids like beclomethasone can increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis. Bradycardia, high-pitched voice, and hypoglycemia are not common adverse effects of inhaled beclomethasone.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is being treated with an inhaled corticosteroid, which can lead to oropharyngeal candidiasis as a potential adverse effect. The other options are not commonly associated with inhaled corticosteroid use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids such as beclomethasone can lead to oropharyngeal candidiasis as a common adverse effect. Bradycardia, high-pitched voice, and hypoglycemia are not known adverse effects of inhaled corticosteroids.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled beclomethasone can increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis due to its local immunosuppressive effects in the oropharynx. The other options are not associated with beclomethasone use.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Inhaled corticosteroids like beclomethasone can increase the risk of oropharyngeal candidiasis due to their immunosuppressive effects. Bradycardia, high-pitched voice, and hypoglycemia are not common adverse effects of inhaled corticosteroids.
